Since some of you are lost, here's some info for what's happening: this isn't connected to Nakani's other works, it's part one to a standalone piece. The sister doesn't have dementia or anything like it, it's just something that can happen to people who are suicidal. Suicide is looked at as the ultimate selfish way out, but in the majority of cases the people who commit it are no longer really in control of their bodies, they're stuck so badly in their head that they're more of a spectator looking in on themself. Imagine when you drank or smoked too much and you can't really control yourself, but for them it's constant, and they have small periods where they tune back in to reality before they crash again like depicted here after the parents left. During this constant haze they're not really mentally present,  they're more working off internal impulses that otherwise wouldn't be let out, hence her hardly speaking and initiating the whole sexual encounter.

I’ll leave this here because of the implications in this:

Please get help if you’re suffering. Suicide is a choice that you can never take back (obviously) and it WILL affect someone else.

My brother passed two months ago and now, life won’t be the same for me, his family, or his friends.

It is your life to live or end as you see fit, but please know that there are people who care.

Take care everyone. And Rest In Peace.

So the timeline is She used to be cool > We used to be happy > She was cute before? I suppose after She used to be cool, fmc gotten a office job and dyed her hair gray. After those cheesy lines that the fmc said to the phone while talking to Yuuta and their parents, they began to worry to the thought of her being suicidal. Making the title "We used to be happy" And then after We used to be happy, she got fired or resigned from her job and dyed her hair back to blonde. I suppose the mc liked the gray hair and that's why the title's name is "She was cute before". The mc is still going to school (I think) due to the doctor giving him a business card for the immunoregulation lab on She used to be cool 2. I don't know if those were joke panels. So yeah. I don't know if the mc for She was cute before is Yuuta but for She was cool before and We used to be happy, the mc name is both Yuuta. This might be a dumb theory.

I! Detective DIO has found the right timeline ( in my theory ) for those who still wondering what apeshit is going on.
Nakani Create " she used to be -" in 1 world, meaning all of it was connected, it was started at the dj " she used to be cute" where the mc is a red haired guy ( important for my theory) who has a blonde lil sis ( apparently all fmc in this series is blonde ) who attention seeker ( in a "ahem" way) to mc, get fked, then happy ending (???), then move on to the next dj is " she used to be cool " where the mc this time is different, instead of older brother it's young brother ( you still reading this mean you read half of it, thanks, and shotacon alert!), and a..... well, fmc with having mental breakdown.... the parent goes to the phychiatrist who is a guy with..... red hair and glasses ( wild guess, but i feel he is the mc from prev dj) , then they do the things that make this dj is 18+ ( no shit sherlock), then we timeskip to this dj, " 'we' used to be happy"

With the same mc and fmc, now the reason i use (') on (we) because how mc resolve the problem in prequel dj, ( also why she change from the old her to what she is when prequel is in there) , in this dj she gone far away from her " safe blanket " ( easy imagination is linus in snoopy... no not snoop dog the weedmaster), and once again she has " mental breakdown". and well i did read the 2nd part if this " we used to be -" not in the right order, but all in all, you should read it in order, at least she used to be cool" then " we used to be happy", " she used to be cute " is just an explaination on why the phychiatrist asking the lil bro rather than the mother. Well if you read it till this then i must thank you for taking your time in reading this DIO, now i Dio must go back to heaven to admire my Jonathan Body, arrivederci.

I believe the framed picture of a butterfly on her wall has some sort of symbolism, it's said in Japanese culture a butterfly can symbolize "the emergence of womanhood and longevity", but I believe that instead of this meaning, the western interpretation of a butterfly is a better fit, in the west a butterfly symbolizes death and rebirth, and a butterfly is just the form the soul takes on as it heads to its next life. I believe one of these siblings is dead, the last panel as well could be interpreted as her being confused at seeing the soul of her brother, she already quit her job but was seen getting dressed and ready for one, I think that when Yuuya "woke up", several months or years had passed since they had sex, she had already mourned his death, moved on, and got into a new job.

For those wondering, no, this isn't a sequel to "She Used to be Cool". It's a bit confusing because the main characters looks similar, but Nakani seems to have a series he's building up with the title preface 'She Used to be [x]' that always involves a blonde/light haired sister having sex with her brother. There are 3 separate series afaik.
and no he didn't time travel, I believe she just has a lot of mental problems
Plot is really good

I believed that this is a continuation to the other 2 stories under the name of either "you used to be so cool" or "she used to be so cool" (I blame the translators for using 2 different names for this series) They were younger in that series. After their school years, sister went to work in another city alone. She was always having a mental health issues in that series. Though she looks as though she is cured, but stress and loneliness caught up with her and she becomes depressed again. Her brother caught it when she called to chat up with him and their mother. Part 2 of this is really epic ending (in my opinion). I really like this artist's storytelling. Although some called the face his fmc made during sex weird. I think they're nice.

I love the unusual behavior Nakani gives to the characters. The way she strips while poorly pretending to be asleep on purpose. How the guy inspects her body like he's checking the health of an animal. Their faces of insecurity while doing something they've been wanting so much. All of that mixed with the feelings involved results into something really unique. I'm not into incest, but I think this author makes great use of the theme.
